reviewText: I haven't watched the Heartbreak Ridge disc yet but Firefox has never looked or sounded better.  It's not reference quality by any stretch but it is a significant improvement over the DVD in every respect. Firefox is a great movie, btw.

Since there are already few reviews on Fire Fox, I will review on Heartbreak Ridge.
Clint Eastwood is a talented director. He excels not only in action and drama genre, but heartwarming comedy as well. Most of his movies are worth watching over and over again. One of my favorite is HBR. This is Eastwood's version of Hoosiers(both films were opened in almost same time though. Also 1986 was a year filled with movies centering a wild man who intends to break the severely blocked system/society). The movie may seem stereotypical Gungho story just by looking at the poster and the disc case, but if you watch it, you'll realize it's really about a generational shift in US Armed Forces. Solders who fought in the times of Cold War were facing the retirement...and here, an old soldier trying to pass his torch to the next gen and considers that's his final mission since he believes that's only way to tribute to his fallen comrades. But before doing so, he must fight the military system he loved so much, unexpected generational gap, and his own personal life which had became so rigid and comfortless that his divorced wife doesn't even want to see him ever again. The protagonist is walled in by so much adverse circumstances...how does he intend to overcome them all?  The good old fashioned Marines way!(of course, that's the only way he knows haha) I believe it's quite symbolic that the film begins from police cell sequence and ends with... :D  But you can enjoy this film simply as a great war film filled with explosive action scenes too. And now...beer and popcorn time! :D Enjoy!

This is a must have if you have a MANLY MAN SECTION in your DVD collection!!! They don't get tougher than Clint!!! The seller ships VERY QUICK!!! No damage!!!  WILL SHOP AGAIN
  Yours truly, MADDMIKE908

I had previously seen both movies, but not in blu-ray.
"Firefox" is about a plot for an ex-Air Force pilot to steal the latest Russian fighter. The beginning portion of the movie took too long, and not enough time was used for the actual theft of the plane. Regardless of my opinion, it was an exciting movie with good special effects. The blu-ray color definitely enhanced the enjoyability of the movie.
"Heartbreak Ridge", is a story about a veteran Marine assigned to a bunch of marine misfits in a "Recon" squadron. Eastwood plays the role of a Gunnery Sergeant, whose job was to shape up the misfits into a combat ready platoon.
It was interesting watching the development of the unit, were assigned to combat. Again, the color of the blu-ray edition enhanced the pleasure of the movie.
I would recommend this order to those who enjoy Clint Eastwood action movies!
JTB

I have always been a huge fan of Firefox, lumping it in with Hunt for Red October for my "superior Russian tech we must steal" flicks. I was surprised at out crisp the blu-ray transfer is and really enjoyed watching it for the first time in a few years.

The sound design/mix is of particular interest to me - the soundscape they engineered for this film is exceptional. At no time during the plane visual effects sequences do you feel like you are listening to a post-produced "mix" - it registers as very real for me, which is great because the model effects don't always hold up as I would like them to.

Great price point and two movies to boot (still have to check out Heartbreak Ridge). Enjoy!

Please describe the audio and video quality of any Blu-Ray you review.  Thanks to those who do this.

Both movies have DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1 soundtracks, which are very good.

Video quality varied throughout the movies.  Firefox started out very good, and had a lot of very good parts, but some parts were grainy.  The flying scenes at the end were, unfortunately, grainy.  Heartbreak Ridge also had some very good parts, and some grainy parts.  Video quality in these two movies wasn't great, but mostly good.

Overall, these are pretty good movies, and I'm not terribly disappointed with the video quality.  I'm satisfied with this purchase.

I'm happy to report that the somewhat misleading use of the term "2 movie set", while true, is less informative than '2 Disc Set'. Yes indeed this is a 2 disc set, not '1' as widely speculated prior to release (also shown as '1 disc' on Amazon's product page).

For a taste of the Cold War at its height (and near its conclusion), Firefox is a great blast from the past.  They tried hard in the film to highlight all sorts of elements of the Soviet apparatus, including dissident scientists, Jews who were downtrodden and oppressed by the system, bureaucrats mindlessly following orders, the vastness of the country, and the intransigence of the pre-Gorbachev leadership.  The Soviet leader portrayed here is a kind of Breshnev-meets-Andropov figure, who is hoping for a technological leap above the Western powers.  This film also taps into the then-prevalent Western fears that the Soviets would make some kind of technological breakthrough that would tip the balance of power inexorably in their favour; of course, time would reveal that they were much more worried about our technological and economic advances with which they could never really compete.  But that's too complex for a film like this, which is already a spy-thriller, chase, and military adventure film rolled into one.  It succeeds for the most part on these levels - Clint Eastwood plays the still-having-flashbacks pilot drafted into the mission of stealing the new MIG-31, a plane so technologically advanced it can operate on mental commands, but limited enough that it would only recognise them in Russian (Eastwood played a pilot fluent in Russian).

In a somewhat strange role, Nigel Hawthorne (one of my all-time favourite actors) played the key Russian scientist, reluctantly but effectively developing the technology, but just as effectively determined to help it be stolen.  Many of the other actors are British, including those playing Russians and those playing Americans.  All are reasonably effective, though there are few stellar performances here.

The special effects are very good - John Dykstra of Star Wars fame produced many of the elements in this.  Scenes of flying in the cockpit and the dogfights between the planes are very effective; they were more dramatic, in all honesty, before Top Gun came along, but they remain rather good even in comparison.

In all, this is an interesting film, a bit overlooked now because time has moved on past the subject matter.  It is one of the earlier films produced and directed by Clint Eastwood, who has gone on to much bigger and grander projects, but one can see his touch here.

For the second film in this package, one also gets a later Cold War scenario, this time in the tropics rather than the frozen Siberian arctic.  Eastwood plays a tough-as-nails, no nonsense Gunny who has to whip a sadsack platoon of misfits into fighting Marines.  Good thing he's a Medal of Honor winner, something that irks his desk-bound, procurement specialist commander to no end.  There are lots of stereotypes here - no complete Gomer Pyles, but several close seconds.  Of course, the administrator/commander is against everything the Gunny wants to do, but the wiser general in the end saves the day for Gunny, as he and his platoon save the day for students trapped on the Caribbean island as Cubans try to take over.  And the film ends with a rousing parade, unlike the return from Vietnam.

On the whole, two good killing-time films; far from great fare, but entertaining, especially for those who like a military theme (friends of mine in the USMC particularly like to sit and pick out the technical problems with Heartbreak Ridge!).

With all the news about Russia going on right now, how can you not want to see a film where the Americans steal a Russian super-jet and bring it back to the U.S?  I think it's one of the best of Eastwood's films in a role that was perfect for him.  Though made about twenty years ago, still is very believable and relevant to today.  And you get a bonus Eastwood film, Heartbreak Ridge, for free!  Nice package of two excellent films in Blu-ray.

Firefox with it's awful special effects deserves a remake or at least a pass with today's special effects, but holds up as a great Cloak and Dagger flick full of sacrifice and intrigue that climatically ends in dog fight. There are some very cool moments in this film although I could have done without the flash backs.

Heartbreak Ridge is a campy Full Metal Jacket that doesn't even deserve that comparison.  Eastwood plays a gunnery sargent that has to adjust to the changes in his beloved marine core and take on one last fight with this new platoon.
Heartbreak is one of my all time favorite movies. Clint Eastwood kicks butt and takes names. Firefox is good too.

If you like Clint Eastwood, you have to see both these films.  They are very different from each other, for sure.

Firefox concerns stealing the ultimate flying machine from the Russian commies, and Heartbreak Ridge is about an old CMOH gunnery sergeant who trains a platoon and takes them to war in Grenada... and teaches them to be men.  Yes, there are lots of laughs along the way as well.  What until you see the size of the human mountain who shows up to teach the sergeant a lesson!

Two of Clint's military efforts that use his demeanor to solid results. Is awesome as the Gunny who gets his less than motivated platoon into shape, and solid again as the retired pilot brought in to steal Russia's best airplane.

Both movies are OK to watch. If you check other movie review sites, you'll see they also give these 2 flicks a so so rating.  I think that's fair.  I just want to comment on the quality of the Blu-ray.  Both movies have very good video and audio quality (DTS).  So, that's pretty good.  Some of the older movies that were converted to Blu-ray were done so in name only when their video and audio quality were just on par with DVD.

Ordered it for my hubby and he LOVES IT!  He's a big fan of Clint Eastwood and so am I.

Love the movies, but the transfers feel like a basic upscale rather than new transfers to the higher resolution, which are getting annoying with many older Blu-ray movies, especially as we move to the newer much higher 4K resolutions, it will only get exacerbated.

To me, Firefox is one of the best film Clint Eastwood ever acted in (besides the Man with No Name series).  The filming, actings and plots are all of very high standard (Heartbreak Ridge is slightly below par as compared with).

Both films transcribed very well into Blu-ray and the price of such nice combination is very acceptable.

Strongly recommended for all CE's fans.

The movie "Firefox" alone is worth the price. It has whatever you like; thrills, action, suspense, intrigue - the whole enchilada. It qualifies as one of my "best." Having the second film is icing on the cake. "Heartbreak Ridge" is not as good but it holds up and is worth watching. If you are an Eastwood fan, this is whoopee time.

I'm a huge Clint Eastwood fan and have been collecting his movies on BluRay.  This disc makes a very convenient and inexpensive way of getting two movies for the price of one.

As for the Firefox movie it's a great movie and so is Heartbreak Ridge.  It's better quality over the old copy I have and as for the sound well let's just say it's not really 5.1DDS.  It's better than the original 2chnl dvd with better picture quality.  So yes it is better..!  If your that much of a stickler for sound and picture quality then don't buy this.  But if you want better than vhs or old dvd then buy it and I bet you'll like it over the old original old stuff.

First let me say that I don't like the 'Foxfire'.  It may be just me but I have trouble believing Clint as a fighter pilot.

The other half of the double feature however makes it all worthwhile.  Clint is totally believable in the part of an aging, hard drinking Gunnery Sergeant who because he says it like it is and does what's necessary has become political incorrect.  He has been sidelined by his new commande to supervise the misits in his Recon Platoon, whom the commander regularly uses to make the Headquaters Platoon look good.
Great example of Blueray version of Firefox,a cult-classic of Clint Eastwood's acting skill. Will soon see Heartbreak Ridge.  Recommended even for Firefox alone.

Firefox on the other hand is a different type of Eastwood movie.  He is of course still the hero but it is his intelligence  that he shows off.  Good movie duo.

2 great movies, 1 low price! If you are a fan of Firefox (or Heartbreak Ridge) and always wanted an HD copy of it, then this is what you have been looking for. The picture quality is good and brings out the details you missed when you owned this on VHS or DVD, Another great thing is that the movies are on their own separate discs, so no combo disc here.

One thing of note is that the HD version of Firefox, the edges are cropped just a bit as compared to the letter boxed DVD version. It's something you won't notice unless you look for it. But then again, it's something most people won't even notice or care about since most just focus on the center of the screen.
excellent duo of Eastwood.
